title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks - BBC News
summary: legal experts say a landmark court ruling in favour of a hertfordshire woman has dealt a major blow to the rights of people to choose who they want to leave money to in their wills .
the fraud case of tina beloveth powerful is set to cost milton keynes council around £ 8,000 .
a naturist couple who spent more than £ 100,000 on improving their home in hertfordshire have won a legal bid to stay .
an 11th hour offer has been made to buy penn school , a special school threatened with closure .
the family of a woman with learning disabilities who died at the lister hospital in stevenage say her death was avoidable .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all from the team on local live for today .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow but , until then , our top stories from today :
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police tackle people urinating in hitchin alley
text: residents who have to walk down an alleyway to their flats in hitchin are having to suffer with repeated incidents of anti-social behaviour and people using the alley as a toilet .
police have issued a warning to those using west alley , just off of the market square , and have installed cctv in an attempt to deter offenders .
patrols of the area have been increased and police will be issuing anyone caught behaving inappropriately with a fixed penalty notice .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: eggs stolen from toddington honesty box
text: a woman in toddington has put images from her cctv on social media after thieves took nearly 200 eggs from her honesty box and drove off .
maryanne smith said the thieves stole £ 40 worth of eggs on sunday from her business , country blooms florist in toddington .
ms smith has run the honesty box outside her business for the last six months .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: mk open uni students to be monitored by algorithms
text: students at the open university are going to have their
the scheme , developed by the ou , has been designed to observe students ' paths through courses and engagement with online learning modules .
the ou 's prof john domingue told the bbc : `` this has been developed as a tool for tutors to help students .
we are planning to use this data for students studying in 2015-16 . ''

documents.title: mk mum owes her life to ambulance volunteer
text: a mother from milton keynes , who had a heart attack on her way to work , says she owes her life to the st johns ambulance volunteer who stopped to help .
carmen green , 42 , who has four children , was being driven to work by her husband when she suddenly collapsed .
mrs green 's husband , andrew , pulled over to dial 999 and was trying to do chest compressions when 37-year-old justin crook ran up to help .
he 'd been driving past and saw what happened .
he took over doing chest compressions until two paramedics arrived .
mrs green woke up two months later in hospital from a medically induced coma .
she 's now urging others to learn first aid .
author: Gail Sanderson
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : showers becoming less frequent
text: tonight : a few showers continuing overnight , but they should become less frequent .
winds will slowly ease too and a cooler night is expected than the one just gone with lows around 10c ( 52f ) .
wednesday : sunny spells but also further showers at times .
west or south-west winds likely to be quite gusty in and near the showers and feeling quite cool in the breeze with highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: bellingham tribute to be unveiled in aylesbury
text: a plaque to commemorate the life of the actress lynda bellingham is to be unveiled in aylesbury .
the promenade at the waterside theatre is to be named after her during a ceremony that will take place on monday .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: if you 're just catching up
text: top stories this evening for beds , herts and bucks :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bucks fire warn about chip pan fires
text: buckinghamshire and milton keynes fire and rescue
why you must never put water on a chip pan fire .
from broughton fire station 's open day on sunday

documents.title: will battle : over 60 % of us do n't have wills
text: the rspca says it may appeal after a woman from hertfordshire was awarded more than £ 160,000 as an inheritance by the appeal court , despite her mother leaving her entire estate to animal charities .

`` over 60 % of us still do n't have wills and we ca n't speak from the grave so the importance of the will is that it at least sets out what you 'd like to happen '' , said paula myers , a lawyer who deals with will disputes .
`` [ people ] need to talk to their family so that there are n't any nasty surprises . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: driver pleads guilty to causing death in hemel
text: a driver has pleaded guilty in court to causing the death of a teenager fatally injured when he was hit by a car .
fazan ahmed , 16 , was struck by a vehicle that failed to stop on 22 august last year in jupiter drive , hemel hempstead , hertfordshire .
andrew john lane , 22 , of stoney avenue , northchurch , admitted causing death by careless driving and driving while being uninsured at st albans crown court .
he was disqualified from driving immediately and will return to the court on 28 august for sentencing .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News, East of England

documents.title: rob hall signs for season at mk dons
text: attacker rob hall has signed up for a whole season on loan at the mk dons .
he originally came to the dons in march ,
among his achievements last season was a hat-trick during the 6-1 win over leyton orient .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: man deported after holding children against their will
text: a man who held two children against their will at a property in hoddesdon , hertfordshire in 2013 has been deported back to italy .
forty-two-year-old fiorenzo buzzanca of stanstead road pleaded guilty to a strong of offences including false imprisonment , criminal damage and threatening to destroy or damage property .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: river wye in west wycombe
text: the main image on our live page today shows the river wye in west wycombe .
the river wye is a chalk stream in the chilterns , which are
thanks to john o'reilly for this image .
i 'd love to see some of your photographs - please drop me a line to bhblive @ bbc.co.uk .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: will battle : what does it mean ?
text: when melita jackson died in 2004 she made it crystal clear she did n't want her estranged daughter heather ilott to benefit , and so left her estate to animal charities with which she had little connection .
the relationship between mother and daughter soured when , aged 17 , heather eloped with her future husband .
yesterday she was awarded a third of the estate because her mother had n't left `` reasonable provision '' for her in the will .
she 'll now be able to buy her housing association property and wo n't lose her state benefits .
experts say the ruling means you can still disinherit your children , but you 'll have to explain why and what connects you to those you do leave money to .
that 'll make it easier for adult `` disinherited '' children to challenge wills and claim greater sums by way of reasonable provision .
author: Clive Coleman
Legal correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: former tvp chief says police may no longer attend burglaries
text: last month , bedfordshire police announced it would be prioritising 999 calls and making appointments for incidents like burglaries where there was low risk , and today the head of the new
sara thornton , who was chief constable at thames valley police until recently , told the
`` the sorts of crimes that are on the increase - sexual offences , concerns about terrorism , cyber crime - that 's where we really need to focus '' , ms thornton said .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: news so far this afternoon
text: the top stories this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: naturist couple fight eviction : a background
text: the owner of spielplatz , the so-called 'naked village ' in brickett wood , wanted to evict a naturist couple because the company said their wooden chalet had been transformed into a more permanent structure .
john and maureen pearson bought their chalet in 1992 for £ 36,000 and went on to virtually rebuild it entirely between 2008 and 2012 .
speilplatz limited claimed the couple had as few rights as squatters and launched court action to evict them after they added breeze blocks and put on a new roof .
sir colin rimer at the court of appeal ruled their chalet had become `` part and parcel '' of the land on which it stood .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: police pup goes to the airport
text: the latest on beds , cambs and herts police dog unit 's new police pup blade this afternoon
they

documents.title: mk council may not re-coup powerful costs
text: milton keynes council may not be able to re-coup any of the £ 8,000 spent on the case of convicted fraudster tina beloveth powerful .
a succession of non-appearances and adjournments mean powerful has already appeared at milton keynes magistrates ' court 11 times , but at a previous hearing the court heard how she had no income .
powerful , 47 , from milton keynes , is currently the subject of an arrest warrant issued by the court last friday after she failed to appear for sentencing .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tina beloveth powerful case to cost around £ 8,000
text: the case of convicted fraudster tina beloveth powerful ,
powerful is yet to be sentenced for her offences , having failed to turn up at milton keynes magistrates ' court on three occasions since her conviction .
in all , her case has been to court 11 separate times .
a warrant without bail , issued for her arrest by magistrates after she failed to turn up at court last friday , has not yet been executed .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman gets £ 164k of estranged mother 's will : your calls
text: we brought you the news yesterday that a judge had overruled a woman 's will to donate her
well today , it was the topic of
karen in harlington told the programme she thought the decision was awful as it would set a precedent and enable anyone to challenge a will .
anthony in hertfordshire , however , said the judge was right and the woman should not have disowned her daughter .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: naturist couple win fight against eviction
text: a couple who live in britain 's most famous naturist club , spielplatz in hertfordshire , have fought and won a test case bid by their landlord to evict them .
john and maureen pearson have occupied a plot in the community since 1992 and have spent over £ 100,000 improving their home .
two years ago , court action was launched against the couple who were told by their landlord , spielplatz limited , that they had as few rights as squatters .
in april last year , a judge ruled the couple were protected by the housing act 1988 , and today a judge dismissed the landlords challenge to that ruling .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: huge fly-tip in woughton
text: household and building waste has been dumped between the end of colne and hatton on tinkers bridge .
the council has described the behaviour as unacceptable .
this is n't the first incident and the council is appealing for anyone with any information to come forward so the issue can be prevented in future .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: will battle : your comments
text: a hertfordshire woman has won £ 164,000 of her mother 's will after being cut out for eloping in 1978 .
you 've been having your say on the matter on
cliff
however , helen

documents.title: sunny spells forecast this afternoon
text: there 'll be plenty of sunny spells this afternoon .
there is the risk of isolated showers in places but most areas should stay dry .
although it will be breezy with temperatures remaining below average , it will feel pleasantly warm in the sunshine .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f )
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: three arrested after watford attempted robbery
text: three people have been arrested in connection with an attempted robbery at a jewellers in watford this morning .
the offenders are currently in police custody being booked in , police say .
officers were called to the intu shopping centre just before 10:00 to reports of the robbery , where the offenders are believed to have tried to break the windows of the shop .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: if you 're just catching up
text: the top stories this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: witness appeal after mk head-on collision
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a head-on collision in milton keynes last thursday , which has left two people in hospital .
just before 08:00 , a grey peugeot 107 and a black ford fiesta collided on watling street in knowlhill between childs way and chaffron way .
a red volkswagen polo was also hit .
a 62-year-old man driving the peugeot suffered a fractured leg and abdominal injuries .
a 38-year-old woman driving the ford suffered bruising and cuts .
the driver of the volkswagen was uninjured .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: eileen smith inquest : lawyer says 'death was preventable '
text: a lawyer for eileen smith 's family has said the coroner 's conclusion recognised `` multiple failings '' in her care contributed to the cause of her death and that `` had these not occurred , her death may have been prevented '' .

merry varney said : `` despite observations showing a deterioration in her health , it appears her silence was taken as a sign she was ok and no steps were taken over a 12-hour period to seek further medical attention for her despite it being obvious she was receiving treatment her doctor had prescribed .

`` we welcome the steps the trust has taken since our client 's complaint and it is an important legacy for eileen that patients in the lister hospital are now significantly safer than they were at the time of her admission . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: herts woman cut out of will wins a third
text: a hertfordshire woman cut out of her mother 's will has been awarded a £ 164,000 inheritance in what
melita jackson died in 2004 , leaving her £ 486,000 estate to animal charities - the rspca , rspb and blue cross charities - after never forgiving her daughter , heather ilott , for eloping at 17 .
mrs ilott , from ware , took the case to court where a judge ruled she should receive a third of the estate .
mrs jackson made her last will in 2002 with a letter to explain why she had disinherited her only daughter .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: rubbish is a risk to st albans primary school pupils
text: rubbish is a risk to st albans primary school pupils
author: The Herts Advertiser

documents.title: bodybuilder death : pair jailed for drug offences
text: two men , convicted of drugs offences as part of an inquiry into the
sean cleathero , 28 , died in october 2012 at the apollo gym in high wycombe , buckinghamshire , after taking a legal chemical dinitrophenol ( dnp ) .
peter purkins , 48 , of hazelmere , and jason king , 43 , of great missenden , were found guilty of supplying steroids , classified as class c drugs .
purkins was jailed for 18 months and king for 13 months at the old bailey .

documents.title: eileen smith inquest : hospital trials new electronic observation system
text: the hospital criticised by a coroner after the death of a woman with learning difficulties , who died after a failure to follow the trust 's escalation procedures when her observations became concerning , said it is trialling a new electronic observation system .
eileen smith , 69 , died at the lister hospital in stevenage on 18 february 2014 , from faecal peritonitis .

director of nursing at the east and north hertfordshire nhs trust , angela thompson apologised to the family of miss smith , before adding : `` rather than information such as temperature , blood pressure , etcetera being written on paper charts , they are now entered in to an online system that escalates concerns automatically . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: attempted robbery at watford jewellers
text: more on the incident in watford we just mentioned .
police were called to the intu shopping centre just before 10:00 to reports of an attempted robbery at a jewellers .
hertfordshire police believe offenders tried to break the windows of the shop causing a series of loud noises , which some members of the public may have thought were gun shots .
police say they 'd like to reassure people that no gun shots were fired , nor was it `` a terrorist incident '' .
the investigation is ongoing .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: police presence and road closed in watford
text: we 're being told stephenson way in watford is closed , that there is a helicopter circling and there is a significant police presence .
i 've put a call in with the police so will update you as soon as i get more information .
the watford observer is
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: cancer diagnosis sparks donations for wedding
text: despite being diagnosed with terminal cancer , a dream wedding is on the cards for lauren barker thanks to
author: Biggleswade Today

documents.title: woman and boy treated following kitchen fire
text: a woman and a boy have been treated for breathing in smoke after a fire at their flat in aylesbury .
bucks and milton keynes fire and rescue service said two crews were sent to deal with the kitchen fire at the property in queensgate , fairford leys at about 01:45 this morning .
they woman and boy were taken to hospital .

documents.title: penn school : parents say there 's still hope
text: an offer has been made to buy penn school , a special school in buckinghamshire , which is set to close at the end of the month .
parents met with head teacher mary-nest richardson last night at the school , which is currently being run by administrators .
`` we know there are interested parties .
i was contacted by somebody completely separately over weekend and they are seriously looking at it '' , said parent amanda burgess .
`` they have n't made an offer yet , there 's nothing on the table , but there is still hope and while there 's still hope we 're still going to fight . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel : van fire blocks aylesbury road
text: grenville road in aylesbury is partially blocked in both directions near the churchill avenue junction due to a van fire .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: tv detective blogs following show
text: a bedfordshire police detective who appeared in a channel 4 show has written about the challenges of policing in a
the first episode of the new series of `` 24 hours in police custody '' aired last night and followed bedfordshire police as officers investigated cases in luton .
`` obviously it can be a very challenging role , but we do what it takes to get the job done , '' det insp emma james wrote .
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: eileen smith inquest : the background
text: eileen smith was sent to the lister hospital in stevenage on 17 february 2014 by the qeii hospital in welwyn garden city with a `` purple folder '' detailing the extent of her difficulties and personal care needs .
her observations were satisfactory until 17:00 , but attempts to contact the medical team were unsuccessful because the wrong bleep number was used and this was not further escalated .

subsequent observations required urgent contact with the medical team caring for her , but no further attempts to contact them were made overnight even though a doctor was contacted for another extremely ill patient .
just after 05:00 on the morning of 18 february she was found to be cold and clammy with very low blood pressure - she suffered a cardiac arrest and attempts to resuscitate her were unsuccessful .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: police issue drink and drugs warning to standon calling revellers
text: hertfordshire police have issued crime prevention and safety advice to music fans heading to the
author: Herts & Essex Observer

documents.title: bedford to cambridge link options considered
text: network rail says
it says they offer the best value for money at this stage , and more work will be done to choose one preferred option , before actual routes are planned .
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: penn school offer made
text: an offer has been made to buy a buckinghamshire special school threatened with closure .
at a meeting , head teacher mary-nest richardson told parents that of the five interested organisations , one has come forward and they have until friday to put up the money .
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: hospital criticised for 'gross failure '
text: a hertfordshire hospital has been criticised by a coroner after an inquest into the death of a woman with a learning disability , which resulted in communication difficulties which meant she was unable to say whether or not she was in pain .
eileen smith ( 69 , died at the lister hospital in stevenage on 18 february 2014 , from faecal peritonitis .

in a narrative verdict , hertfordshire coroner edward thomas said her death followed `` a gross failure to escalate concerns about a learning disabled patient which were clearly apparent from nursing observations carried out for the last 12 hours of her life '' .
he said : `` escalation in accordance with the procedures is more likely than not to have prevented her death . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : dry and fine but staying cool
text: after a cloudy start , there 'll be sunny spells later , but also the risk of isolated showers in some spots .
most places are set to stay dry , though , with highs of 19c ( 68f ) .
it will be staying dry overnight with strengthening winds , which will make it feel rather chilly .
author: BBC Weather
